字幕内容: Xiao-Die: Gege
when will ah-ba and mom come and take us home?
Qi Yan: They will come for us once our younger brother is born.
Buqin: Prince
this can’t go on for much longer.
Perhaps I should slaughter my horse!
Qi Yan: Uncle Buqin
字幕颜色: as people of the grass plains
column5: we cannot kill horses even if it means…

字幕内容: Leading Wei soldier: There they are
Other soldiers: Understood!
Buqin: Protect the Prince and Princess!
Leading Wei soldier: Go!
Surround them!
Other soldiers: Understood!
Timur: We’ve been spotted by Wei kingdom thieves!
Buqin: Timur
take half of our people and escort the Princess to the north
the rest will continue to escort the Prince south with me.
We’re splitting up!
Even if no one survives
we must keep the last of the great Khan’s bloodline safe!
Got it?
Timur: Understood!
Xiao-Die: Gege
字幕颜色: I don’t want to part with you!

字幕内容: Qi Yan: Xiao-Die…
Uncle Buqin
Xiao-Die: Gege
Qi Yan: I’m the one they’re after
Xiao-Die
you have to live on…
Qi Yan: Just wait a while
it won’t be long
gege will find you again.
Announcer: Adapted from Jinjiang Literature City’s original work by Please Don’t Laugh
‘Clear and Muddy Loss of Love’
produced by Yinhang Media
broadcasting exclusively on Maoer FM
‘Two Adamant Hearts’ audio drama
season one
episode one
please enjoy.
Shopkeeper: You’re here
Qi Yan: This is a book I transcribed in the past two days
please give it a look-through.
Shopkeeper: This old man will bring the master scholar’s payment right away.
Qi Yan: Just a moment
this junior has also brought two modest works this time
this is a short lyric I wrote in a moment of inspiration during my travels.
Please have a look.
Shopkeeper: A pavilion surrounded by snow the white of jade
emptied the night of its color.
Flowers overtake the threshold
competing in spring charm.
Goodness
this is exquisite!
Qi Yan: You’re too kind
This is ‘Inscription at the sweet springs by Jiucheng palace’.
This stone inscription is one of the treasures of the Jin province.
As someone from the Jin province
the sight of it is a lasting memory
hence I ventured to transcribe it yesterday.
Shopkeeper: You are indeed talented for your age
your use of the Wei Stelae style
has truly been eye-opening for this old man.
It won’t be long before the name of the Hermit Shepherd
becomes widely-known in the capital city!
Qi Yan: Thank you for the compliment
but I still hope that my identity will be kept hidden
Shopkeeper: Rest assured
this old man has been running this bookshop for half a lifetime.
Examinees who come to sell their writing under a different name
due to financial problems is nothing rare here
my lips have always been sealed!
Qi Yan: In that case
Shopkeeper: Take a seat over there
I will bring you the payment.
Qi Yan: Thank you.
Qi Yan: Is that…
Wu Da?
What is he doing in the capital city?
Nangong Jingnu: So this is life in the world of commoners…
Shopkeeper: Master scholar!
Your silver!
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge
字幕颜色: can you take me out here more often?

字幕内容: Nangong Jingnu: Jie…
Qi Yan: My apologies.
Nangong Jingnu: How can you be so rude?
You knocked down my
my er-ge
why didn’t you stop and help?
Nangong Jingnu: Take this!
That’s for getting distracted even after knocking down my er-ge!
Qi Yan: That’s… clearly a feminine voice.
Nangong Shunu: Jing-er
come and help me up.
Qi Yan: I’m sorry
has the young master been hurt anywhere?
Nangong Jingnu: Take your filthy hand away!
Nangong Shunu: Jing-er
do not be rude.
Qi Yan: These two…
The older one is undoubtably a woman
but the younger one…
is rather domineering
despite the soft features.
Perhaps they are sister and brother?
If Xiao-Die was still alive…
she’d be around this age too.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge
Nangong Shunu: I’m fine
there’s no more dust on me.
Nangong Jingnu: No
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge
Qi Yan: This one was at fault for knocking down the young master
will the young master be visiting a clinic?
Nangong Shunu: It is fine
I can wrap up this minor injury back at the estate.
Qi Yan: In that case
farewell.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge!
Are you letting him go just like that?
Nangong Shunu: He might not have meant it.
Perhaps he has an urgent matter to attend to.
Nangong Jingnu: But…
Nangong Shunu: He does not appear to be someone from the capital city.
His clothes are plain
and he carries a trunk on his back
so he is most likely a scholar who travelled here to take the capital exam.
Consultation fees are not cheap in the capital
it could cost him a few days’ worth of food.
Must we put him through that?
Nangong Jingnu: A visit to the doctor could cost a few days’ worth of food?
Nangong Shunu: That’s right.
Nangong Jingnu: Is… that what father often calls
the hardships of the common people?
Nangong Shunu: Alright now~ Not so loud
we’ll be heading back after returning the folding fan
so don’t create more trouble.
Nangong Jingnu: I got it
Nangong Shunu: Drifting leaves of willow
drifting drizzles of rain
spring in a muddled place.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge
you’re returning this folding fan
but you’re opening it to appreciate it again
have you gotten too attached?
I have got to see what this Hermit Shepherd is like
since they can write such excellent poetry!
Nangong Shunu: If you keep teasing me like that
I’m going back to the palace.
Let’s see who will accompany you when you’re scared of the dark then!
Nangong Jingnu: Er-ge~
Nangong Jingnu: Oh
that’s right
that person earlier… His eyes seem to be different from ours.
It’s
Nangong Shunu: Oh? It could be a trick of the light…
Qi Yan: Wu Da
what are you doing here.
Wu Da: A message from the master.
The main examiner of this spring exam is the Head of the Secretariat Xing Jingfu
while the two vice examiners are the Minister of Personnel Deng Hongyuan
and Vice Minister of Personnel Shu Liren.
You should plan ahead.
Qi Yan: I’ve got it.
This is not a place to linger.
Unless it’s necessary
I hope that you won’t appear in front of me again.
Wu Da: Do not forget your original goal.
The masked person: The Jing kingdom is no more
you are now on your own.
To drift through life
it is your choice to make.
Qi Yan: What happened that year
is engraved in my heart
I will not forget
and I’d dare not forget.
[Qi Yan opens the wooden door
[then slowly enters the house
字幕颜色: dropping on the chair. Slowly folds up pant leg]

字幕内容: Qi Yan: That little young master can really kick…
Though
the way he protects his older sister
is really like Xiao-Die.
If Xiao-Die was still here
she’d be this big too.
Qi Yan: Xiao-Die…
If I had known things would turn out like this…
I really should have taken you with me
and we’d never separate again.
Wei soldiers: Go!
Ding Yi: Heel—  Who said you could shoot? Cease at once!
Minor official: Understood!
Ding Yi: Sir Commandant’s birthday is coming up
and that lowly slave has presented a rare Ferghana horse
just as I was troubled over the lack of a suitable gift!
Send this order down
I want that horse alive
and if anyone harms that horse
I’ll take his head off his shoulders!
As for the rest
it doesn’t matter if they live or die!
Minor official: Understood!
Order from the General
capture the rare horse alive
the lives of the rest don’t matter!
Soldiers: Understood!
Qi Yan: Uncle Buqin
Buqin: Heel-
Stop
Buqin: Prince
our warriors have fallen
and our horses can’t run any further!
Qi Yan: What do we…?
Buqin: Prince
as long as you still live
our tribe will eventually be revived one day!
Everyone
turn back with me
let’s charge with everything we’ve got!
Guards: Understood!
Fugitives: Fight! Charge/take them down with us!
Qi Yan: Uncle Buqin!
Buqin: Run!
Run!
Don’t look back!
Keep running!
Buqin: Run—
Qi Yan: Flowing Fire
let’s go!
Qi Yan: Flowing Fire
stay strong!
Qi Yan: End of the road…
Ding Yi: Heel—
There’s only the Luo river ahead
he can’t escape!
Surround him
Capture that precious horse
but as for its rider
throw him to the slavers!
Minor official: Understood!
Qi Yan: In your dreams!
I’m the Prince of the Jing kingdom
I’d rather die than be a slave!
Soldiers: Big talk for a little kid…
Qi Yan: Xiao-Die
you have to live on for me!
Go--!
Qi Yan: Ah-ba
mom
Xiao-Die
Baying
I will make them pay this debt of blood
and I won’t stop till my dying breath!
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
you have to take me outside more often in the future!
Nangong Shunu: Alright.
Jing-er.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
Nangong Shunu: The second young master of the Lu estate has come looking for you
let’s go by the back gate instead?
Lu Zhongxing: Your Highness!
Your Highnesses!
Nangong Jingnu: Zhongxing-gege!
Lu Zhongxing: Mm~
Nangong Shunu: Jingnu
can you ask second young master Lu to keep our outing a secret?
Nangong Jingnu: Don’t worry
Nangong Shunu: I’ll head inside first then.
Nangong Jingnu: See you later
Lu Zhongxing: Zhenzhen Highness.
Why is Second Highness walking away?
Nangong Jingnu: Zhongxing-gege~
Can you do one thing for me?
Lu Zhongxing: Of course
it doesn’t even have to be just one
I’ll do anything for you any time!
Any request from Your Highness is…
Nangong Jingnu: You can’t tell anyone
about er-jie and me leaving the estate to play!
Lu Zhongxing: Alright!
Nangong Jingnu: You won’t tell Emperor Father either?
Lu Zhongxing: I won’t!
Nangong Jingnu: Promise!
Lu Zhongxing: I promise!
Nangong Jingnu: Did you bring anything tasty or fun
to the estate today
Lu Zhongxing: I did
you’ll see once you go back.
Nangong Jingnu: Really?!
Lu Zhongxing: Mm
really.
Nangong Jingnu: I haven’t entered the palace in a while
I wonder what Emperor Father is doing.
Lu Zhongxing: I heard that the Emperor misses the Princess all the time these days
wondering if you might be sleeping poorly
Sijiu: Your Majesty
you have been marking reports for over four hours
it is not good for your health.
Nangong Rang: You old thing
when did you start talking like those concubines?
Sijiu: The Ladies are naturally worried for Your Majesty’s health as well.
Nangong Rang: How has my child been doing lately?
Is she getting used to life outside of the palace?
Is she eating well?
Having fun?
Sijiu: Answering Your Majesty
the cooks at the Zhenzhen Princess estate
are all transferred from the Weiming Palace
Her Highness has Chuntao and Qiuju attending to her needs
and the company of Second Highness.
The Zhenzhen Highness is surely doing quite well.
Nangong Rang: Mm…
The outside world can hardly compare to the inner court.
Are there enough guards on duty?
Sijiu: The imperial guard
has been assigned to the Princess estate yesterday.
He is certainly skilled enough to keep the Princess estate safe.
Nangong Rang: My daughter is all grown up now
she has learned how to sulk at her father.
Nangong Rang: The Commandant estate
the Lu family.
The Lu family…
Nangong Rang: Sijiu…
Sijiu: This old servant is here.
Nangong Rang: Do you still remember
the First Empress’ appearance?
Sijiu: Her Lady’s graceful bearing is unforgettable.
Nangong Rang: The First Empress and I wedded in our youth
we were deeply in love
together through thick and thin
yet she has gone before me…
leaving our only bloodline
If I cannot even keep our daughter safe
how will I have the face to see her
again under the nine springs?
Sijiu: Your Majesty…
Nangong Rang: It’s no matter.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
are you asleep?
Nangong Shunu: Not yet
come in.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
I was afraid you might not be used to the beds outside the palace
so I’m here to accompany you.
Nangong Shunu: Or it’s because you’re scared of the dark
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
Nangong Shunu: Why don’t I see a servant girl with you?
Who is on duty today?
Nangong Jingnu: Chuntao
she’s tired out from searching for me all day today
so I told her to go to sleep.
Nangong Shunu: Oh you
should I say that you’re clever
What kind of master is worried about tiring out their servants?
Why did you come over on your own when you’re scared of the dark?
Nangong Jingnu: How is that a big deal?
I’m someone who left the palace and established my own estate now
I can handle this!
Nangong Shunu: Among those two personal attendants of yours
Qiuju is rather reliable
but Chuntao…
has gotten lazier after leaving the palace.
Perhaps you should move back to the palace.
Emperor Father cares so much about you
why must you hold a temper against him?
Nangong Jingnu: That’s Emperor Father’s fault for saying something like
‘since my child turning fourteen
it’s time to find a good Fuma for my child’ all of a sudden!
Er-jie is already sixteen
字幕颜色: but Emperor Father is in no hurry.

字幕内容: I don’t want to marry anyone so soon!
Nangong Shunu: As women
even if we’re Princesses…
We have to marry someone eventually.
Nangong Jingnu: Anyway!
Until Emperor Father let’s that go
I refuse to return to the palace!
Nangong Shunu: Spring chill is in the air
sleep inside and cover up.
Nangong Jingnu: Mm!
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
it’s my fault for getting so distracted
we didn’t get to return the fan today.
Can I go again with you another day?
Nangong Shunu: No
the great exam is starting soon
it would be better not to disturb him for now.
We have time in the future.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie
do you think…
that Gongyang Huai is really the Hermit Shepherd?
Nangong Shunu: I saw this fan drop from his arms
at the poets meeting that day.
Nangong Jingnu: Er-jie entered a scholars’ poetry club in disguise too?
Can you bring me along next time?
Nangong Shunu: The next meeting will likely only occur after the great exam.
By then
even I might not be able to participate
how am I supposed to bring you along as well?
Nangong Jingnu: Why is that?
Nangong Shunu: I am just a Princess born from a concubine
how could I ever have the privilege to leave the palace for an estate of my own?
Nangong Shunu: I’ve been staying with you for some time
it is time for me to return to the palace.
Any longer
my mother will start to worry.
Nangong Jingnu: Oh…
Er-jie
say
why would Gongyang Huai
sign his own fan with a penname
when he’s the son of a Minister?
The Hermit Shepherd…
Is there a deeper meaning to that name?
Nangong Shunu: Perhaps…
he has his own reasons.
Nangong Jingnu: Also
the scholar that bumped into er-jie yesterday
really had amber eyes
those eyes are so unique
I’ve never seen eyes like that!
Nangong Shunu: It happened so fast that I did not quite notice it
though I have heard that the people of the Jing kingdom speak barbarically
have strong builds
unusual features
and amber eyes.
But that scholar’s stature was not unusual
and he spoke rather politely.
And besides
how could people from the Jing kingdom possibly enter the capital city?
Perhaps you were seeing things…
It’s night
time to sleep.
Nangong Jingnu: Alright.
[Nangong Rang’s dream]
Sijiu: Fire!
Fire….
Nangong Rang: Hurry
字幕颜色: hurry up and keep that beast away from me

字幕内容: escort
Nangong Rang: Escort
Sijiu: Your Majesty!
Your Majesty!
Nangong Rang: Sijiu…
Sijiu: Yes.
Nangong Rang:…I
I had a dream…
Quick
summon the soothsayer!
Sijiu: As Your Majesty decrees!
Sijiu: Summon the soothsayer at once!
Guo Qingliu: This subject
字幕颜色: soothsayer Guo Qingliu greets Your Majesty.

字幕内容: Nangong Rang: Have a seat.
Guo Qingliu: Thank you
Sijiu: Your seat
Sir Guo.
Nangong Rang: I…
had a dream.
Guo Qingliu: This subject is listening with all ears.
Nangong Rang: I dreamt of a strange beast that rose from the waters
it came to this palace on a cloud pushed by the wind.
It hovered above the palace for a moment at first
then it killed all of the imperial guards with one sneeze.
Afterwards
that strange beast came towards my bedchamber.
Accompanied by… the flickering light of fire
it blew the windows open
and it glared at me fiercely with its enormous eyes.
The roars of that strange beast sent chills down my spine.
Dear minister
what do you make of this dream?
Guo Qingliu: Congratulations
it is a highly auspicious sign.
Nangong Rang: Do elaborate.
Guo Qingliu: Your Majesty is a true draconic son of heaven
the father of nine sons.
The noble blood of a true dragon can easily subdue strange beasts.
Though that strange beast was unstoppable
it stopped in front of Your Majesty in the end
and it did not harm Your Majesty.
The great exam is only a few days away
this subject will boldly offer a prediction…
A remarkable talent for the ages will appear in this year’s palace exam.
Nangong Rang: You may go now.
Guo Qingliu: Understood.
Nangong Rang: A remarkable talent for the ages…?
But this dream still unsettles me…
Ding You: Long time no see
Qi Yan.
Qi Yan: Ding You?
What are you doing here instead of staying in the imperial hospital?
Ding You: I have my own reasons.
Qi Yan: Come in.
Ding You: You on the other hand
why are you awake in the middle of the night watching a fire in the courtyard?
Could it be that… you’ve learned how to foretell the future
so you’re waiting for me ahead of time?
Qi Yan: Is there ever really such a thing as predicting the future?
You didn’t get followed on the way here
Ding You: Relax
it’s the middle of the night
and your place is so far out…
And besides
who will pay any mind to the whereabouts of a mere imperial doctor?
Qi Yan: That’s good.
The great exam is almost here
whether I succeed or fail depends entirely on this event.
I don’t want anything to go wrong.
Ding You: Your health is weak
what are you doing out in the courtyard where it’s damp and chilly?
Qi Yan: In recent years…
everything has changed.
Only the starry sky above remains the same as it ever was.
It’s just a shame that…
I’ll hardly have the opportunity
to appreciate it from now on.
Ding You: And why is that?
Qi Yan: I need an explanation for my uncommon eye color after all.
Fortunately
字幕颜色: Shifu arranged my family registration to be in the Jin province

字幕内容: so I made use of the deadly plague in Jingjia First Year for my story.
I can just say that I almost lost my life to it as a child
and I somehow made it out alive
only to have my eyes permanently changed by the illness.
Not only in color
but my vision becomes impaired at night as well
and I can’t take any wine.
By the time the exam results are published
this should become known as well…
How can someone who cannot see at night gaze upon the starry sky?
Ding You: Although it’s a good cover
it could become troublesome for you in other ways as well.
Even if you want to take revenge
you should at least make life more comfortable for yourself.
Why make it harder?
Qi Yan: Harder?
The Wei kingdom’s court is corrupt
new graduates are bound to be pulled in different directions by various factions.
I will have to socialize when the time comes.
This cover will actually save me plenty of trouble instead.
I’m certain that I don’t have an absurdly high capacity for alcohol
so it would be better not to touch any at all
to avoid any potential mistakes made in a lack of sobriety.
Ding You: I’m not as smart as you
nor do I have a foresight like yours.
All I have is some skill in medicine
but I hope I can be of help to you.
Qi Yan: I hope you didn’t come here in the middle of the night just to reminisce?
Ding You: Of course not
I’m here at this hour to tell you two things.
One is that I have a solid foothold in the imperial hospital now
so you can go ahead and do what you need to.
Even if you become a minister of high position one day
there’s no need to worry
I will find a way to serve as your imperial doctor.
And the other thing is…
a word from the master.
Qi Yan: What did Shifu say?
Ding You: Master wanted me to tell you that
old thief Nangong loves to fool public opinion by doing things for fame and prestige.
There has been an increase in taxes and levies in recent years
and people have been complaining for a long time.
In order to appease the public
there will definitely be a commoner
among the top three graduates of the palace exam this year.
The palace exam only allows for four hours of marking.
Old thief Nangong won’t be able to read each essay carefully
that is why effort must be put into the penmanship!
The master personally taught you calligraphy for this very purpose
but it won’t hurt to be careful.
Your success hinges on this!
Qi Yan: I’ve got it.
Tell Shifu to rest assured.
Ding You: Master also said that
although the Champion
are the same rank
there has been an unwritten rule since the previous dynasty
where the title of Flower Seeker will only be given to those
who are excellent in both studies and appearances.
Ministers in the court
also love to ask for His Majesty to grant marriages
putting Flower Seekers into their estates as son-in-laws.
You must be careful…
Do not get marked as Flower Seeker.
Qi Yan: I’ve got it.
It’s getting late
I won’t be escorting you.
Ding You: You know
字幕颜色: we did grow up together after all

字幕内容: and we haven’t seen each other for three years. I won’t say anything about catching up
but the way you’re chasing me out…
Qi Yan: Ding You!
Ding You: What
regretting it already?
Want me to stay a while longer?
Qi Yan: I’ve already told you this three years ago
when I saw you out of the nameless valley.
Qiyan Aguna is already dead
there is only Qi Yan in this world.
Once you walk out that door today
imperial doctor Ding You
and Jin province scholar Qi Yan
will be complete strangers.
Do keep that in mind.
